metadata.title: CVE-2021-47520 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: can:pch_can: pch_can_rx_normal: fix use after free After callingnetif_receive_skb(skb), dereferencing skb is unsafe. Especially, thecan_frame cf which aliases skb memory is dereferenced just after the callnetif_receive_skb(skb). Reordering the lines solves the issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47520` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1078-fips - 4.15.0-1078.87
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1078-fips - 4.15.0-1078.87
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1078-fips - 4.15.0-1078.87
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1078-fips - 4.15.0-1078.87
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2061-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2061.63
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2061-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2061.63
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2043-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2043.47
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2043-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2043.47
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2026-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2026.28
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2026-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2026.28
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1078.87').
linux-aws-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2061.63').
linux-azure-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2043.47').
linux-gcp-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2026.28').
